clusters.title: 'Good riddance, you grub': Child killer Bevan Spencer von Einem dies in prison
clusters.neutral_headline: Convicted child killer Bevan von Einem dies in prison

items.title: 'Good riddance, you grub': Child killer Bevan Spencer von Einem dies in prison
items.standfirst: Convicted child killer Bevan Spencer von Einem, 79, died in Yatala Labour Prison early this morning following a period of declining health due to lung cancer.
items.content: Convicted child killer Bevan Spencer von Einem, 79, died in Yatala Labour Prison early this morning following a period of declining health due to lung cancer.Von Einem was serving a life sentence for the 1983 abduction and murder of 15-year-old Richard Kelvin, who was subjected to five weeks of torture before his body was discovered in the Adelaide foothills.The death of von Einem has been met with mixed reactions.READ MORE: 12 homes destroyed, damaged as bushfire rips through NSW Central Coast "I'd love to say good riddance to the grub, yeah, good riddance you grub, you're where you belong and I hope it's a horrible place," Richard Kelvin's best friend Karl Brooks said.Robyn Barnes, the sister of Alan Barnes, another suspected victim of "The Family Murders", added, "You're about to reap what you sow ... karma is a bitch."Premier Peter Malinauskas acknowledged the gravity of von Einem's crimes."Von Einem is probably one of the most notorious criminals that we've ever seen in the history of our nation, an appalling human being who committed some of the most heinous acts that we've ever seen in our state's history," he said.Von Einem was long suspected of involvement in a network known as "The Family", believed to be responsible for the murders of other young men in the late 1970s and early 1980s. Alan Barnes, Peter Stogneff, Neil Muir, and Mark Langley are widely believed to have been victims of the group. Despite extensive investigations, no one else has ever been charged in connection with these murders.READ MORE: Sydney's first heatwave this Summer has authorities on high alertThe families of the victims express ongoing frustration that von Einem never revealed any information about the alleged "Family" network."Angry he's taken those secrets to the grave, even though I knew he wouldn't talk, I knew he wouldn't talk," Robyn Barnes said."Our family's been ripped to pieces and scattered in the winds," Alan Barnes' brother John said.Despite von Einem's death, the investigation into "The Family Murders" remains active."Now my mission is just to fight for the truth ... you know, hopefully get some justice, get some closure, for all the victims left behind by this," Brooks said.This article was produced with the assistance of 9ExPress.

items.title: Child killer dies in prison
items.standfirst: Bevan Spencer von Einem has died in prison in Adelaide while serving a life sentence.
items.content: Bevan Spencer von Einem has died in prison in Adelaide while serving a life sentence.

ai_summary: Bevan Spencer von Einem died in prison.
He was a convicted child killer.
He was serving a life sentence.
He died in Yatala Labour Prison.
He was 79 years old.

clusters.title: Fourteen Australians arrested in Bali in raid involving controversial content creator Bonnie Blue
clusters.neutral_headline: Australians arrested in Bali in raid
bullet_summary: Controversial content creator Bonnie Blue is reportedly disappointed over her continued detention as she remains in police custody in Kuta

items.title: Fourteen Australians arrested in Bali in raid involving controversial content creator Bonnie Blue
items.standfirst: Controversial content creator Bonnie Blue is reportedly disappointed over her continued detention as she remains in police custody in Kuta.
items.content: Fourteen Australians have been arrested in Bali, as part of a police raid on controversial content creator Bonnie Blue over alleged pornographic activity.Bonnie Blue is still in custody in Kuta after her arrest.The 26-year-old is barred from entering Australia but has been boasting on social media a bout her trip to Bali during Schoolies.READ MORE: Sydney to swelter through more heatwave conditions as nine regions face total fire bans Blue has been seen travelling in a ute and picking up young men as part of this tour.Police have confirmed they have seized several items, including camera equipment and clothing.The 14 Australian men who were arrested have all been released without charge.READ MORE: Man fighting for life after an alleged assault outside hotel in Sydney's southMany of the men were seen leaving the police station, covering their faces, but also filming.A 28-year-old Australian man remains in custody, along with two British men and Bonnie Blue herself.She is expected to undergo further questioning. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.title: Sydney hit by heatwave
clusters.neutral_headline: Sydney experiences major heatwave with high temperatures

items.title: Sydney hit by heatwave
items.standfirst: Sydney has sweltered through a heatwave with temperatures close to 40 degrees.
items.content: Sydney has sweltered through a heatwave with temperatures close to 40 degrees.

items.title: Sydney's temperatures top 40 degrees as major heatwave grips the city
items.standfirst: T emperatures rose above 40 degrees today - and there will be no relief tomorrow.
items.content: T emperatures topped 40 degrees in parts of Sydney today as a major heatwave gripped the city.Suburbs in the city's west hit 40-degree temperatures as north-westerly winds spread from Central Australia. The city exceeded the Bureau of Meteorology's expectations, reaching 38 degrees. READ MORE: 'It's the Taylor Swift of hams': The best ranked heading into ChristmasNSW Ambulance Superintendent Steve Vaughan has warned people to beware of the heat."Everyone's susceptible to heat, whether you're young and fit, whether you're from a different social background or different cultural aspects," he said.On the Mid North Coast, a bushfire at Bulahdelah burned through the night.The blaze shut parts of the Pacific Highway, with residents being told to watch and act."Help our volunteer lifesavers out, swim between the flags. You know, know about risks on the beach—know how to spot and identify a rip current and be safe this summer," Adam Weir from Surf Life Saving Australia said.Temperatures are expected to surge again tomorrow, with a forecast maximum of 36 degrees in the mid-afternoon for the city.The BoM issued a heatwave warning yesterday that extends through to tomorrow. "Severe heatwave conditions are expected to peak on Friday and Saturday before easing on Sunday as a cooler change extends across the State," the warning read.The surging temperatures will not be confined to Sydney, with other affected regions including the Hunter, Illawarra, Central Tablelands, Southern Tablelands, and Snowy Mountains .Total fire bans are in place for a number of western and southern districts including the Lower Central West Plains, and the Northern, Eastern, and Southern Riverina.READ MORE: Former NRL star Josh McGuire charged with strangling child The fire danger for much of the state, including Greater Sydney, the Hunter, and Illawarra, is expected to reach "Extreme" tomorrow.People are urged to find ways to stay out of the heat today, including by drawing blinds or awnings early to keep the heat out of their home.Fans and air-conditioners are also recommended. READ MORE: The best ways to keep cool in hot weather DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.standfirst: Ejjeh is a traditional omelette made with eggs, herbs, spices and that soft zucchini flesh that would otherwise go to waste. It's simple, fresh and full of flavour.
items.content: Ejjeh is a traditional omelette made with eggs, herbs, spices and that soft zucchini flesh that would otherwise go to waste. It's simple, fresh and full of flavour.

ai_summary: Ejjeh is a traditional Lebanese omelette recipe.
The omelette is made with eggs, herbs, and spices.
It utilizes zucchini flesh that would otherwise be wasted.
The dish is described as simple, fresh, and flavorful.
The recipe offers a protein-rich and tasty meal option.

clusters.title: Rare look at family, country and culture on the beautiful APY Lands
clusters.neutral_headline: APY Lands Offer Rare Look at Culture and Country

items.title: Rare look at family, country and culture on the beautiful APY Lands
items.standfirst: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.
items.content: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

ai_summary: The APY Lands showcase Australia's protected beauty.
The area is rich with ancient songlines and culture.
Elders see a need for change to secure the future.
The article highlights the importance of cultural preservation.
The APY Lands are a significant cultural landscape.

clusters.title: Australia's youngest senator was catfished on social media as a teen
clusters.neutral_headline: Youngest Senator Shares Social Media Catfishing Experience

items.title: Australia's youngest senator was catfished on social media as a teen
items.standfirst: As the social media ban for teens looms, the parliament's most recent senator reveals she knows firsthand the dangers that can confront young people online.
items.content: As the social media ban for teens looms, the parliament's most recent senator reveals she knows firsthand the dangers that can confront young people online.

ai_summary: Australia's youngest senator was catfished on social media.
The senator experienced this as a teenager.
A social media ban for teens is being considered.
The senator understands the dangers online.
The experience informs her perspective on the issue.

clusters.title: Expensive flights don't pass the pub test in the age of belt-tightening
clusters.neutral_headline: Expensive Flights Raise Questions About Government Spending

items.title: Expensive flights don't pass the pub test in the age of belt-tightening
items.standfirst: How does a treasurer tell households the government will no longer continue a $300 energy rebate when it's happy to blow $100,000 on three flights?
items.content: How does a treasurer tell households the government will no longer continue a $300 energy rebate when it's happy to blow $100,000 on three flights?

ai_summary: Expensive flights are questioned amid belt-tightening measures.
The government is ending a $300 energy rebate.
The government spent $100,000 on three flights.
The situation raises questions about fiscal priorities.
The public may question the government's spending choices.

clusters.title: Europe faces obstacles in preparing for Russian aggression
clusters.neutral_headline: Europe Faces Challenges in Preparing for Russian Aggression

items.title: Europe faces obstacles in preparing for Russian aggression
items.standfirst: When it comes to weaponry, Russia has strength in manpower despite Ukraine's early technological edge while Europe's arms production efforts are running into infrastructure hurdles.
items.content: When it comes to weaponry, Russia has strength in manpower despite Ukraine's early technological edge while Europe's arms production efforts are running into infrastructure hurdles.

ai_summary: Europe faces obstacles in preparing for Russian aggression.
